definition: long term/long time/long range (of a forecast)
a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]
ever since a long time ago
(fig.) guarantee of financial support for the rest of one's life

sentences.english: Corneal ulcers occur most often in patients who use extended-wear soft contact lenses.
sentences.chinese: 角膜溃疡最常发生于长期使用软性角膜接触镜的病人。

sentences.english: I worked with Viktor Frankl, a Nazi prison camp survivor, for many years.
sentences.chinese: 长期以来，我曾帮助过一位纳粹集中营幸存者。

sentences.english: This is one of the best novellas I've read in a long time.
sentences.chinese: 这是我长期以来读过的最优秀的中篇小说之一。

sentences.english: What side effect does long-term drop eyedrop have?
sentences.chinese: 长期的滴眼药水有什么副作用啊？

sentences.english: Again, I'm not opposed to long-term deficit reduction, so long as it's equitable.
sentences.chinese: 同样，我不反对长期削减赤字，只要它的公平。

sentences.english: As a result, it is not necessary to maintain a positive ketosis test long term.
sentences.chinese: 这样一来，就没有必要坚持长期测试积极酮症了。

sentences.english: Then the factors which effected spacecrafts long-time adjoint flying were listed and analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 分析影响航天器长期伴随飞行的各种因素。

sentences.english: In Gambia 11 journalists have been jailed for extended periods in 2006.
sentences.chinese: 在冈比亚，11名记者在2006年被判长期徒刑。

sentences.english: Nanyang opera developed its own characteristics in its history.
sentences.chinese: 在长期的发展过程中，宛梆形成了独特的审美特征。

sentences.english: The world famous brand electrical control components to ensure long-term trouble-free operation of the machine.
sentences.chinese: 世界名牌电器控制元器件，确保机器长期无故障运行。

sentences.english: Are you aware that many researchers are convinced that prolonged close work causes myopia?
sentences.chinese: 你认为，许多研究员确信长期近距离工作引起近视吗？

sentences.english: The town was forced to yield after a long siege.
sentences.chinese: 该城受长期围困而被迫弃守。

sentences.english: It is a long and humble business.
sentences.chinese: 这是一项长期而卑下的任务。

sentences.english: Our spirit is"customer first, honesty first". we establish a long-term cooperation relations with a number of enterprises.
sentences.chinese: 的原则，与多家企业建立了长期的合作关系。

sentences.english: The report said the pipeline agency was hampered by a chronic inspector shortage.
sentences.chinese: 报告说，长期缺乏检查员妨碍了管道安全局开展工作。

sentences.english: The development of new, alternative insecticides is an expensive and long-term endeavour.
sentences.chinese: 新的替代杀虫剂的研发是一项昂贵的长期努力。

definition: to lead to/to create/to cause/to bring about
all year round/for years on end/average year
year in, year out (idiom)/(over) many years
ever since a long time ago
due to/as a result of/thanks to/owing to/since/because
to be in (some state, position, or condition)
